Package com.circa.mrv.grs_manager.manager

Class GRSManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.circa.mrv.grs_manager.manager.GRSManager
  • public class GRSManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The grs manager class handles users of the grs manager. It allows users to log in and out by verifying their credentials, it contains the administrator user information and handles administrator creation, and it allows the niox catalog and employee directory to be obtained.
    Author:
    Arthur Vargas

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static GRSManager getInstance()
        Obtains or creates an instance of the grs manager. A new instance is created when first called and subsequent calls return the instance. Ensures that only one instance is able to be created.
        Returns:
        the instance of the registration manager.

        Gets the order record that was created
        Returns:

      • login

        public boolean login​(java.lang.String id,
                     java.lang.String password)
        Logs a user into the grs manager after checking the passed id and password. If the employee is located in Sweden, then the employee's password is checked against the passed password. If there is a match, then the Sweden employee is logged in. If the passed Id and password match the administrator's Id and password then the user is logged in as the administrator. If the id and/or password matches a Morrisville employee, then the Morrisville employee's password is checked against the passed password. If the employee is located at a research company location, then the employee's password is checked against the passed password. If it matches the employee is logged in as a research company employee. If the login and password does not match for Sweden, Morrisville, or the customer, then the user is not logged in. If there is already a user logged into the system, the user attempting log in is not allowed. An error is thrown if the user does not exist in the directory.
        Parameters:
        id - the user's id
        password - the user's password
        Returns:
        true if the user is able to be logged in. False otherwise.

      • logout

        public void logout()
        Logs the current user out of the system by setting the current user to null.

      • getCurrentUser

        public User getCurrentUser()
        Gets the current user in the system.
        Returns:

        public Company getCompany()
        Gets the current company in the system

        the company in the system

      • clearData

        public void clearData()
        Clears the user directory and niox catalog by creating new empty versions.

      • addOrderToSchedule

        public boolean addOrderToSchedule​(Order o)
        Returns true if the order is added to the employee's order schedule. Only an employee of a research company or the GRS manager administrator can drop an order from the schedule.
        Parameters:
        o - order the order to be added to the employee's (current user's) schedule
        Returns:
        true if enrolled
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if current user is null or company is not a research company

      • dropOrderFromSchedule

        public boolean dropOrderFromSchedule​(Order o)
        Returns true if the order is dropped from the employee's schedule. Only an employee of a research company or the GRS Manager administrator can drop an order from the schedule.
        Parameters:
        o - order to drop
        Returns:
        true if dropped

      • resetSchedule

        public void resetSchedule()
        Resets the order schedule by dropping every order it contains. Only an employee or the GRS Manager administrator can reset an order schedule

      • addFacultyToCourse

        public boolean addFacultyToCourse​(Order course,
                                  Employee faculty)
        Adds the passed faculty to the passed course if the user is the registrar and if the faculty is able to add the course based on their current course load and schedule.
        Parameters:
        course - The course to add the faculty to
        faculty - The faculty to add to the course
        Returns:
        true if the faculty is added to the course, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a user other than the registrar tries to add the faculty.

      • addEmployeeToCompany

        public boolean addEmployeeToCompany​(Company c,
                                    Employee e,
                                    int i)
        Adds the passed employee to the location at position 'i' of the company's location list if the currentUser is the administrator and position 'i' is valid.
        Parameters:
        c - The company to add the employee to
        e - The employee to add
        i - the position of the location in company's list to which employee will be added
        Returns:
        true if the employee is added to the company location, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a user other than the administrator tries to add the employee.

      • removeOrderFromSchedule

        public boolean removeOrderFromSchedule​(Order order,
                                       Employee employee)
        Removes the order from the passed employee's schedule if the user is the GRS Manager administrator.
        Parameters:
        order - the order to remove the employee's schedule
        employee - the employee whose schedule order will be removed from
        Returns:
        true if the order is removed from the employee schedule, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a user other than GRS Manager administrator tries to remove the order.

      • removeEmployeeFromCompany

        public boolean removeEmployeeFromCompany​(Company c,
                                         Employee employee)
        Removes the employee from the passed company's location where this employee is located. This action can only be completed by the GRS administrator. If the user is not the GRS Manager administrator, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        e - the employee to remove
        c - the company whose schedule order will be removed from
        Returns:
        true if the employee is removed from the company location, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a user other than GRS Manager administrator tries to remove the order.

      • resetFacultySchedule

        public void resetFacultySchedule​(Employee employee)
        Resets the passed employee's schedule if the user is GRS Manager administrator.
        Parameters:
        employee - the employee whose schedule is to be reset.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a user other than GRS Manager administrator tries to reset the schedule.

      • getCompanyDirectory

        public CompanyDirectory getCompanyDirectory()
        Gets the company Directory. If company directory is null, returns a new company directory.
        Returns:
        companyDirectory The directory of the company.
